sentences: Burjaat on rahvas Ida-Siberis Baikali järve ümbruskonnas.
Baikali järv on suurim mageveejärv maailmas.
Järved Eestis on väga kaunid ja looduslikud.
context: The word 'järve' is the partitive form of the Estonian noun 'järv', which means 'lake'. In Estonian grammar, the partitive case is used to indicate partialness or indefiniteness. So 'järve' can mean 'of a lake' or '(some) lake'. It's commonly used when referring to lakes in various contexts such as geography, nature descriptions, and when talking about bodies of water.
